subject: Fix puppet-stack-config lvm devices filter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-24 09:17:14.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/eff6f881278114caccf30af81c558daebea55173', 'message': 'Fix puppet-stack-config lvm devices filter

Current augeas command generates this line in /etc/lvm/lvm.conf:
 global_filter = "[ r|^/dev/disk/by-path/ip.*iscsi.*\.org\.openstack:.*|
]"
which triggers an 'Invalid filter pattern' on lvm services startup
The line should read:
 global_filter = [
"r|^/dev/disk/by-path/ip.*iscsi.*\.org\.openstack:.*|" ]

Change-Id: I215394affed4f8c43ab14cda1201acd762cc50cb
Closes-Bug: #1614153
Co-Authored-By: Jonathan B Craig <jon.craig@gfs.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix puppet-stack-config lvm devices filter

Current augeas command generates this line in /etc/lvm/lvm.conf:
 global_filter = "[ r|^/dev/disk/by-path/ip.*iscsi.*\.org\.openstack:.*|
]"
which triggers an 'Invalid filter pattern' on lvm services startup
The line should read:
 global_filter = [
"r|^/dev/disk/by-path/ip.*iscsi.*\.org\.openstack:.*|" ]

Change-Id: I215394affed4f8c43ab14cda1201acd762cc50cb
Closes-Bug: #1614153
Co-Authored-By: Jonathan B Craig <jon.craig@gfs.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/24/359724/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: changes => 'set global_filter/list/1/str "r|^/dev/disk/by-path/ip.*iscsi.*\.org\.openstack:.*|"'

commit_message:
Fix create/delete/abandon environment redirect_url

Now create/delete/abandon environment redirect_url using
"horizon:project:murano:environments", will cause the
NoReverseMatch error. This patch fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1616697

Change-Id: I27a25f6d2f8854df1cc19a783dabf2717e6e513a

commit_message:
Use repr in debug output of SSH and subprocess

Use repr in debug output of SSH and subprocess
This will prevent decode errors, while non unicode
 non ascii data will present in input
 (Example: binary coded cyrillic environment value set)

Change-Id: I6c20e43444df150ff7fd7902421f6f44dc20fe12

A docker application could specify resources required to run the application and resource limits the application should obey.
The patch is added this possibility for reservation and limiting memory resource used by a docker application.

Memory resources of a docker application are controlled by `--memory` and `--memory-reservation` flags of the `docker run` command.
Memory resources of a docker application hosted on kubernetes are controlled by `resources` field of the container spec.

More details could be found here:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/release-1.3/docs/design/resources.md#resource-specifications
https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/run/#/user-memory-constraints

commit_message:
Memory limit support for a container deployed in a K8s pod and a docker host

A docker application could specify resources required to run the application
and resource limits the application should obey. The patch is added this
possibility for reservation and limiting memory resource used by a docker
application.

Memory resources of a docker application are controlled by `--memory` and
`--memory-reservation` flags of the `docker run` command. Memory resources of
a docker application hosted on kubernetes are controlled by `resources` field
of the container spec.

More details could be found here:

https://goo.gl/Uhjofj
https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/run/#/user-memory-constraints

Change-Id: I7220429862c0510a7e86aa74e3fa55f33a1bd23b

added_lines: - $knownResources: {} - $memoryResource: $container.resources.get(memory) - If: $memoryResource != null Then: - If: (($memoryResource.limit) != null) and (($memoryResource.limit) < (4*1024*1024)) Then: - $msg: format('Memory resource limit for {1} container should be greater or equal to {0}', $container.Name, $memoryResource.limit) - Throw: MemoryResourceLimitException Message: $msg - If: (($memoryResource.request) != null) and (($memoryResource.request) < (4*1024*1024)) Then: - $msg: format('Memory resource request for {1} container should be greater or equal to {0}', $container.Name, $memoryResource.request) - Throw: MemoryResourceLimitException Message: $msg - $knownResources[memory]: $memoryResource - For: resourceName In: $knownResources Do: - $resourceObject: $knownResources.get($resourceName) - $._environment.reporter.report($, 'Resource object {0}={1}'.format($resourceName, $resourceObject)) - If: $containerDef.resources = null Then: - $containerDef.resources: {} - If: $resourceObject.limit != null Then: - If: $containerDef.resources[limits] = null Then: - $containerDef.resources[limits]: {} - $containerDef.resources[limits][$resourceName]: $resourceObject.limit - If: $resourceObject.request != null Then: - If: $containerDef.resources[requests] = null Then: - $containerDef.resources[requests]: {} - $containerDef.resources[requests][$resourceName]: $resourceObject.request

commit_message:
Fix neutron db failure in update_port

The portbinding db operations will cause foreign constraint
violation due to multiple nested transactions in update_port.

Closes-Bug: #1618808
Change-Id: If6487b3d9b434a447f3aba9d3a1b123f991c08a7

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from proboscis import test from fuelweb_test.helpers.decorators import log_snapshot_after_test from fuelweb_test import settings from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import SetupEnvironment from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import TestBasic @test(groups=["test_bdd"]) class TestBlockDevice(TestBasic): """>>>>>>>>>>>>""" @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_3], groups=["deploy_bdd"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def test_block_device(self): """Deploy cluster with Cinder Block Device Scenario: 1. Create cluster with Neutron 2. Add 1 nodes with controller role 3. Add 1 nodes with compute and cinder-block-device role 4. Deploy the cluster 5. Network check 6. Run OSTF tests Duration 60m """ self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_3_slaves") self.show_step(1) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, settings={ 'tenant': 'bdd', 'user': 'bdd', 'password': 'bdd', 'volumes_lvm': False, 'volumes_ceph': False, 'images_ceph': False, 'objects_ceph': False, 'ephemeral_ceph': False, 'nova_quotas': True, 'volumes_block_device': True, 'net_provider': 'neutron', 'net_segment_type': settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['vlan'], 'configure_ssl': False, 'neutron_dvr': True } ) self.show_step(2) self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['compute', 'cinder-block-device'], } ) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(6) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id=cluster_id)

commit_message:
Prohibit duplicated names about storlet file and dependencies

Currently, we locate storlet file and dependencies in a same
directory, so when some of their names are duplicated, storlet
can not handle them properly.

Change-Id: I0cf34f452347f602dee468a0aac04803480cc8d7

subject: Make get_info requests useful with recheck_*_existence == 0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-26 14:27:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/4da848b4fd90a22507aa73f6459adbb60378f0b9', 'message': "Make get_info requests useful with recheck_*_existence == 0

Before, when recheck_account_existence or recheck_container_existence
was set to zero, get_info requests for accounts or containers wouldn't
populate the env cache for the current request, so it wouldn't return
the data *it just got*.

Now, we'll still populate the env cache (allowing things to work), but
not memcache. This seems to be what the operator wanted, even if it'll
really hammer their account and container servers.

Change-Id: Ia648263073bc88e35216cafb76821b7ce02c1d03

commit_message:
Make get_info requests useful with recheck_*_existence == 0

Before, when recheck_account_existence or recheck_container_existence
was set to zero, get_info requests for accounts or containers wouldn't
populate the env cache for the current request, so it wouldn't return
the data *it just got*.

Now, we'll still populate the env cache and memcache, as a cache time of
zero means "keep it indefinitely". See the memcache docs at
https://github.com/memcached/memcached/blob/1.4.25/doc/protocol.txt#L163

Change-Id: Ia648263073bc88e35216cafb76821b7ce02c1d03
Closes-Bug: 1224734
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/16/310216/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if cache_time is None: if cache_time: memcache.set(cache_key, info, time=cache_time) else: memcache.delete(cache_key)
deleted_lines: if not cache_time: memcache.set(cache_key, info, time=cache_time)

commit_message:
Restore swift storage directory permissions after upgrade

Any update or reinstall glance-common package triggers
its postinst action with following command:
chown glance:glance -R /var/lib/glance/ /etc/glance/
We use /var/lib/glance/node by default as swift storage
folder http://goo.gl/97VJG2, and reinstallation of
glance-common breaks swift user access to it, so swift
services stop working. So, we need to fix /var/lib/glance/node
folder permissions right after upgrade command.
Also, the case of adding new controller node for already
updated cluster is covered.
This workaround is applied on when swift is enabled.

Closes-bug: #1618553
Related-bug: #1619282

Change-Id: Iea6ce51d6ed9fe42bba1b26b58ba43268a7f880c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/20/363820/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if roles_include(['controller', 'primary-controller']) { $storage_hash = hiera_hash('storage', {}) if (!$storage_hash['images_ceph'] and !$storage_hash['objects_ceph'] and !$storage_hash['images_vcenter']) { # Glance package update changes permissions for /var/lib/glance and makes # it and its subdirectories owned by glance:glance (it executes in postinst stage). # We use /var/lib/glance/node as swift storage, and we need to allow # swift user to write into this directory. We should update all subdirectories # in /var/lib/glance/node to be owned by swift:swift. This should be applied right # after glance package update to decrease swift service downtime to minimum. exec { 'fix_permissions': command => '/bin/chown -R swift:swift /var/lib/glance/node/', onlyif => '/usr/bin/test -d /var/lib/glance/node/', logoutput => true, } } }

commit_message:
Bind dnsmasq to specific interface

Bind dnsmasq to interface specified in astute.yaml instead of IP
provided by facter. Facter may provide IP of docker interface.

Change-Id: Ib1b2c1b23909e1a90061eb0aad0434cab50c3043
Closes-bug: #1616087
(cherry picked from commit 86f44e72be9d8dab987f0f3e07bcd188bab3b49b)

Update link reference for api-ref-guides

own api-ref addresses, so the api-ref-guides should update with
their new addresses.

added_lines: - (String) DEPRECATED: The messaging driver to use, defaults to rabbit. Other drivers include amqp and zmq. Replaced by [DEFAULT]/transport_url * - ``addressing_mode`` = ``dynamic`` - (String) Indicates the addressing mode used by the driver. Permitted values: 'legacy' - use legacy non-routable addressing 'routable' - use routable addresses 'dynamic' - use legacy addresses if the message bus does not support routing otherwise use routable addressing * - ``anycast_address`` = ``anycast`` - (String) Appended to the address prefix when sending to a group of consumers. Used by the message bus to identify messages that should be delivered in a round-robin fashion across consumers. * - ``connection_retry_backoff`` = ``2`` - (Integer) Increase the connection_retry_interval by this many seconds after each unsuccessful failover attempt. * - ``connection_retry_interval`` = ``1`` - (Integer) Seconds to pause before attempting to re-connect. * - ``connection_retry_interval_max`` = ``30`` - (Integer) Maximum limit for connection_retry_interval + connection_retry_backoff - (String) Name for the AMQP container. must be globally unique. Defaults to a generated UUID * - ``default_notification_exchange`` = ``None`` - (String) Exchange name used in notification addresses. Exchange name resolution precedence: Target.exchange if set else default_notification_exchange if set else control_exchange if set else 'notify' * - ``default_notify_timeout`` = ``30`` - (Integer) The deadline for a sent notification message delivery. Only used when caller does not provide a timeout expiry. * - ``default_reply_timeout`` = ``30`` - (Integer) The deadline for an rpc reply message delivery. Only used when caller does not provide a timeout expiry. * - ``default_rpc_exchange`` = ``None`` - (String) Exchange name used in RPC addresses. Exchange name resolution precedence: Target.exchange if set else default_rpc_exchange if set else control_exchange if set else 'rpc' * - ``default_send_timeout`` = ``30`` - (Integer) The deadline for an rpc cast or call message delivery. Only used when caller does not provide a timeout expiry. * - ``link_retry_delay`` = ``10`` - (Integer) Time to pause between re-connecting an AMQP 1.0 link that failed due to a recoverable error. * - ``multicast_address`` = ``multicast`` - (String) Appended to the address prefix when sending a fanout message. Used by the message bus to identify fanout messages. * - ``notify_address_prefix`` = ``openstack.org/om/notify`` - (String) Address prefix for all generated Notification addresses * - ``notify_server_credit`` = ``100`` - (Integer) Window size for incoming Notification messages * - ``reply_link_credit`` = ``200`` - (Integer) Window size for incoming RPC Reply messages. * - ``rpc_address_prefix`` = ``openstack.org/om/rpc`` - (String) Address prefix for all generated RPC addresses * - ``rpc_server_credit`` = ``100`` - (Integer) Window size for incoming RPC Request messages * - ``unicast_address`` = ``unicast`` - (String) Appended to the address prefix when sending to a particular RPC/Notification server. Used by the message bus to identify messages sent to a single destination.
deleted_lines: - (String) The messaging driver to use, defaults to rabbit. Other drivers include amqp and zmq. - (String) Name for the AMQP container

commit_message:
Replace <project> by PROJECT

In the document, we can replace the individual client's project
by PROJECT in pip install command. But in some commands, <project> is
currently used.
This patch replaces <project> by PROJECT to make it be unified

Change-Id: If42a8bac2742dc91f877c2f652d87af026ea6737

commit_message:
Change the way Murano dashboard collects static with UCA packages

Horizon UCA packages collects static during installation
and doesn't recollect it if we use '--clear' option. It leads
to static absesnce. So we need to delete '--clear' option for
Murano dashboard collectstatic script when we use UCA packages

Change-Id: I9719208dff88ce4f3be1b038b8bb6a49a6ec387f
Related-Bug: #1603528
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-murano refs/changes/56/364856/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: let(:collect_static_command) { if facts[:os_package_type] == 'ubuntu' "/usr/share/openstack-dashboard/manage.py collectstatic --noinput" else "/usr/share/openstack-dashboard/manage.py collectstatic --noinput --clear" end } :command => collect_static_command let(:collect_static_command) { if facts[:os_package_type] == 'ubuntu' "/bin/openstack-dashboard/manage.py collectstatic --noinput" else "/bin/openstack-dashboard/manage.py collectstatic --noinput --clear" end } :command => collect_static_command

commit_message:
Fixed dead-locks and race conditions in tasks execution

Also imporved detecting dead-locks in chains, instead
of card-coded chains use generic approach - collect
knowledge about chains and check a new one against
knowledge base.

commit_message:
Prevent replacement of Port, Net and Subnet

There have been cases reported of Neutron resources being reallocated on
some stack-updates. (E.g. the ports which are used for VIP allocation
and feeding VIP info to overcloud config files.) This is quite similar
in the OS::Nova::Server replacement issue in the sense that TripleO
clouds currently cannot recover from this happening. While the triggers
of this behavior might have external causes due to manipulation with
templates or environment files (we haven't found any root cause in
TripleO code yet), in general this is an issue that we should probably
prevent if we can.

Closes-Bug: #1572609
Change-Id: I1bfd3b4c2bf23ddb96905ddc654b807955668922
(cherry picked from commit 13b4e8e86e0b421f02bdf76aec15836261bbda17)

added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import copy import six from heat.engine.resources.openstack.neutron import net from heat.engine.resources.openstack.neutron import port from heat.engine.resources.openstack.neutron import subnet def _copy_schema_immutable(schema): new_schema = copy.deepcopy(schema) if not schema.update_allowed: new_schema.immutable = True return new_schema class ImmutableNet(net.Net): '''Ensure an existing net doesn't change.''' properties_schema = { k: _copy_schema_immutable(v) for k, v in six.iteritems(net.Net.properties_schema) } class ImmutablePort(port.Port): '''Ensure an existing port doesn't change.''' properties_schema = { k: _copy_schema_immutable(v) for k, v in six.iteritems(port.Port.properties_schema) } class ImmutableSubnet(subnet.Subnet): '''Ensure an existing subnet doesn't change.''' properties_schema = { k: _copy_schema_immutable(v) for k, v in six.iteritems(subnet.Subnet.properties_schema) } def resource_mapping(): return { 'OS::Neutron::Net': ImmutableNet, 'OS::Neutron::Port': ImmutablePort, 'OS::Neutron::Subnet': ImmutableSubnet, }

commit_message:
Move VIP-related data to AllNodesConfig

This makes it easier to access the VIP data for other node types and
de-ties this from the controller role.

Change-Id: I71125576ec93889fed134b92fb59f7e7dc9920c4

added_lines: NetIpMap: type: json ServiceNetMap: type: json vip_data: mapped_data: map_merge: # Dynamically generate per-service VIP data based on enabled_services # This works as follows (outer->inner functions) # yaql - filters services where no mapping exists in ServiceNetMap # map_replace: substitute e.g internal_api with the IP from NetIpMap # map_replace: substitute e.g heat_api_network with network name from ServiceNetMap # map_merge/repeat: generate a per-service mapping - yaql: # This filters any entries where the value hasn't been substituted for # a list, e.g it's still $service_network. This happens when there is # no network defined for the service in the ServiceNetMap, which is OK # as not all services have to be bound to a network, so we filter them expression: dict($.data.map.items().where(isString($[1]) and not $[1].endsWith("_network"))) data: map: map_replace: - map_replace: - map_merge: repeat: template: SERVICE_vip: SERVICE_network for_each: SERVICE: str_split: [',', {get_param: enabled_services}] - values: {get_param: ServiceNetMap} - values: {get_param: NetIpMap} - keystone_admin_api_vip: {get_input: keystone_admin_api_vip} keystone_public_api_vip: {get_input: keystone_public_api_vip} public_virtual_ip: {get_input: public_virtual_ip} controller_virtual_ip: {get_input: control_virtual_ip} internal_api_virtual_ip: {get_input: internal_api_virtual_ip} storage_virtual_ip: {get_input: storage_virtual_ip} storage_mgmt_virtual_ip: {get_input: storage_mgmt_virtual_ip} # public_virtual_ip and controller_virtual_ip are needed in # both HAproxy & keepalived. tripleo::haproxy::public_virtual_ip: {get_input: public_virtual_ip} tripleo::haproxy::controller_virtual_ip: {get_input: control_virtual_ip} tripleo::keepalived::public_virtual_ip: {get_input: public_virtual_ip} tripleo::keepalived::controller_virtual_ip: {get_input: control_virtual_ip} tripleo::keepalived::internal_api_virtual_ip: {get_input: internal_api_virtual_ip} tripleo::keepalived::storage_virtual_ip: {get_input: storage_virtual_ip} tripleo::keepalived::storage_mgmt_virtual_ip: {get_input: storage_mgmt_virtual_ip} tripleo::redis_notification::haproxy_monitor_ip: {get_input: control_virtual_ip}

commit_message:
Use python-db-jobs for Glare

Glare wants to test MySQL and PostgreSQL in their unit tests
(see I4b445c6b0b06d3c762426e16c52513c2510dda73), switch the python jobs
to the versions that set up these databases.

Change-Id: I0868a90ed6f78ad80f3d4ce5475f936698225f2e

commit_message:
Do not fail compute node setup if there is no default route

A default route validation should only be done if the IPv6 or
l3 agent os enabled. This is not mandatory for a compute node
setup.

Change-Id: I9b4110aea04d277c6cb64bc3e3462de1a499273b
Closes-bug: #1617522
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/72/361572/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Only validate if there is a default route if necessary if is_service_enabled q-l3 || [[ "$IP_VERSION" =~ .*6 ]]; then default_route_dev=$(ip route | grep ^default | awk '{print $5}') die_if_not_set $LINENO default_route_dev "Failure retrieving default route device" fi
deleted_lines: default_route_dev=$(ip route | grep ^default | awk '{print $5}') die_if_not_set $LINENO default_route_dev "Failure retrieving default route device"

commit_message:
Add flags to enable internal TLS

This adds two necessary environments for enabling internal TLS. One
that sets up the necessary variables. And another one that sets a
reference CA (showing how it can be done).

bp tls-via-certmonger
Change-Id: I34de15e9a04fd634582651c062eecaa279f4a78f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/16/328216/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: EnableInternalTLS: type: boolean description: > Whether to enable TLS for the internal services or not. default: false enable_internal_tls: {get_param: EnableInternalTLS} global_ca: {get_param: GlobalCA}

commit_message:
Add placeholder for Internal TLS template

This sets a placeholder for setting up the template for internal TLS.
This template will be used to to the necessary steps to register to
the internal CA and enable any services required.

It was set to be alongside the public TLS parts since it's necessary
for it to run before other parts of the system that might assume this
is already done (such as the puppet manifests).

The public TLS parts retained their names in order to keep backwards
compatibility, even though the names might not be the most
appropriate anymore.

bp tls-via-certmonger
Change-Id: I6a01c80d3e1f7aca275dafb9137b62ee317f6671
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/14/328214/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: 2016-04-08 description: > This template implements the hook mechanism to get the templates needed for both public and internal TLS. parameters: # Passed in by the controller NodeIndex: default: 0 type: number server: description: ID of the controller node to apply this config to type: string resources: PublicTLSData: type: OS::TripleO::NodeTLSData properties: server: {get_resource: Controller} NodeIndex: {get_param: NodeIndex} InternalTLSData: type: OS::TripleO::InternalTLSData properties: server: {get_resource: Controller} NodeIndex: {get_param: NodeIndex} outputs: deploy_stdout: description: Deployment reference, used to trigger puppet apply on changes value: {get_attr: [PublicTLSData, deploy_stdout]} deployed_ssl_certificate_path: value: {get_attr: [PublicTLSData, deployed_ssl_certificate_path]} key_modulus_md5: description: Key SSL Modulus value: {get_attr: [PublicTLSData, key_modulus_md5]} cert_modulus_md5: description: Certificate SSL Modulus value: {get_attr: [PublicTLSData, cert_modulus_md5]}

Define v2 identity_client as library

Migrate identity v2 API identity_client to tempest.lib and implement
unit test for the service clients.
Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

commit_message:
Make storlet gateway totally independent from swift

This patch removes a dependency of storelt gateway on swift, to make
it as a general gateway module for all software defined storages.

Change-Id: I2edf2ad59a5477441fd2c2035bf0422676f094a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/17/365217/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: storlet_id=self.sobj, params={}, data_iter=iter('body'), options=options) body = '' for data in sresp.data_iter: body = body + data self.assertEqual('something', body)
deleted_lines: from contextlib import contextmanagerfrom swift.common.swob import HTTPException, Request from swift.common.utils import FileLikeIterfrom tests.unit.swift.storlet_middleware import FakeApp self.app = FakeApp() def _create_req(self, method, headers=None, body=None): return Request.blank( self.req_path, environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': method}, headers=headers, body=body) def _create_storlet_req(self, method, headers=None, body=None): if headers is None: headers = {} headers['X-Run-Storlet'] = self.sobj return self._create_req(method, headers, body) @contextmanager def assertRaisesHttpStatus(self, status): with self.assertRaises(HTTPException) as e: yield self.assertEqual(e.status_int, status) sw_req = Request.blank( self.req_path, environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'PUT'}, headers={'X-Run-Storlet': self.sobj}, body='body') reader = sw_req.environ['wsgi.input'].read body_iter = iter(lambda: reader(65536), '') storlet_id=sw_req.headers['X-Run-Storlet'], params=sw_req.params, data_iter=body_iter, options=options) file_like = FileLikeIter(sresp.data_iter) self.assertEqual('something', file_like.read())

Current Nova uses method CONF.set_override to change config option's
value with designated value in unit test, but never check if the
designated vaule is valid. Each config option has a type like strOpt,
BoolOpt, etc. StrOpt with parameter choices only allows values in set of
choices. In short word, each config option has limitation for type and
value. In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input is valid,
but in unit test, test methods can pass if we use method
CONF.set_override without parameter enforce_type=True even we pass wrong
type or wrong value to config option.

fix related violations.

"}]
commit_message:
Set enforce_type=True in method flags

Current Nova uses method CONF.set_override to change config option's
value with designated value in unit test, but never check if the
designated vaule is valid. Each config option has a type like strOpt,
BoolOpt, etc. StrOpt with parameter choices only allows values in set of
choices. In short word, each config option has limitation for type and
value. In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input is valid,
but in unit test, test methods can pass if we use method
CONF.set_override without parameter enforce_type=True even we pass wrong
type or wrong value to config option.

This commit makes enforce_type=True in method flags in nova/test.py and
fix related violations.

Closes-Bug: #1517839

Change-Id: I105dabfec89b01d131257054fbb3669763af6ca9

commit_message:
Make PIP_GET_PIP_URL configurable via local.conf

The default get_pip url regulary times out when starting devstack
from behind company firewalls. Making this a configureable variable,
user can make use of internal git-pip.py mirrors without modifying
any code.

Change-Id: I66a5534d51ab23a4d8586c27d37b4b6b8a6892c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/79/360979/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PIP_GET_PIP_URL=${PIP_GET_PIP_URL:-"https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py"}

commit_message:
Replace assertRaisesRegexp with assertRaisesRegex

assertRaisesRegexp is deprecated in python3
https://docs.python.org/3.2/library/unittest.html

Co-Authored-By: edan david <edand@mellanox.com>

Change-Id: I9446e745239d64ac9adf8fd1a8f95b5befc8cf06

commit_message:
Modify use of assertTrue(A in B)

Developers should use assertIn(A, B) instead of assertTrue(A in B ).

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie169e731c800b5d77fd231f09ac7f92090287ef3

commit_message:
Add info about components versions to main apps

Currently all information of components for images is displayed only in
"Description" of k8s related images. This patch adds info about it to
all related artifacts to allow user see this info, before downloading.

Change-Id: I130de0dad597a95b4e823c7ff8a0fd945ec57be7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/app-catalog refs/changes/91/365591/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This application uses image with follow components: * etcd v3.0.4; * kubernetes v1.3.0; * flannel v0.5.5; * Go v1.6.2; * confd v0.7.1; * docker v1.11.2. Depended application - "Kubernetes Cluster" uses image with follow components: * etcd v3.0.4; * kubernetes v1.3.0; * flannel v0.5.5; * Go v1.6.2; * confd v0.7.1; * docker v1.11.2. With this bundle automatically will be installed application - "Kubernetes Cluster". It uses image with follow components: * etcd v3.0.4; * kubernetes v1.3.0; * flannel v0.5.5; * Go v1.6.2; * confd v0.7.1; * docker v1.11.2.

commit_message:
test_list_servers_by_admin for preexisting servers

test_list_servers_by_admin has been implemented by corresponding to
test_list_servers_by_admin_with_all_tenants which specifies an option
all_tenants. As the bug report, test_list_servers_by_admin expected
admin user should not have any pre-existing servers, but it is possible
on some clouds.
As the original purpose of test_list_servers_by_admin, it is fine to
verify the server list doesn't contain the other tenants' servers.
Then this patch changes test_list_servers_by_admin to do that.
In addition, this patch moves test_list_servers_by_admin to next to
test_list_servers_by_admin_with_all_tenants for comparing them easily.

Change-Id: I4ba5bedef154c1313b6c60f24f177ae3d9ac15ef
Closes-Bug: #1295369
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/70/364570/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.idempotent_id('51717b38-bdc1-458b-b636-1cf82d99f62f') def test_list_servers_by_admin(self): # Listing servers by admin user returns a list which doesn't # contain the other tenants' server by default body = self.client.list_servers(detail=True) servers = body['servers'] if servers is not []: # This case is for the test environments which contain # the existing servers before testing servers_name = [server['name'] for server in servers] self.assertNotIn(self.s1_name, servers_name) self.assertNotIn(self.s2_name, servers_name)
deleted_lines: @test.idempotent_id('51717b38-bdc1-458b-b636-1cf82d99f62f') def test_list_servers_by_admin(self): # Listing servers by admin user returns empty list by default body = self.client.list_servers(detail=True) servers = body['servers'] self.assertEqual([], servers)

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim support for
Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch also adds the
convenience py35 venv.

Change-Id: If2019cb09d0938377ce3d8bab13224675d81ba31

commit_message:
Store node relationship into 'dependents'

When creating container type nodes, user may want to know
the container is running on which vms. Also from the vm
nodes user may wants to confirm if there are containers
running on them. This patch adds these information into
node's 'dependents' property when creating a container node.

Change-Id: I89455522a6ff82947d5f2461589547c896235ddd

Update releases info for Kubernetes applications

After creation new repository, all Kubernetes applications are
suppported since Mitaka. So old versions should be removed from list of
releases.

commit_message:
Block PyMySQL 0.7.7

This release broke oslo.db detection of DBReferenceError and
DBNonExistentTable errors.

We have a fix for oslo.db in master:
Ice7d7767842225951eaf48b71cedb2aabe5a84e4 but since we don't have it
merged, and a new release including the fix, we should walk both paths
in parallel.

Conflicts:
	global-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I33d5ef8f35747d3b6d3bc0bd4972ce3b7fd60371
(cherry picked from commit dfbc65be4c6aa9a650c64997357e62f9a2e0903e)

commit_message:
Block PyMySQL 0.7.7

This release broke oslo.db detection of DBReferenceError and
DBNonExistentTable errors.

We have a fix for oslo.db in master:
Ice7d7767842225951eaf48b71cedb2aabe5a84e4 but since we don't have it
merged, and a new release including the fix, we should walk both paths
in parallel.

Conflicts:
	global-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I33d5ef8f35747d3b6d3bc0bd4972ce3b7fd60371
(cherry picked from commit dfbc65be4c6aa9a650c64997357e62f9a2e0903e)

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I0c6036d18065e83799056b9184efa6f18c1b6c19

Prior to this patch the cleanup_host function was copying only the *.log
files when collecting the logs from Ironic, this patch is removing this

commit_message:
Ironic: Copy all deployment logs

Prior to this patch the cleanup_host function was copying only the *.log
files when collecting the logs from Ironic, this patch is removing this
filter and copying the whole directory instead.

The ironic-bm-logs might contain another directory inside called
"deploy_logs" which contain some troubleshooting information from the
deploy ramdisk.

Change-Id: Icb6952ac96ccc840423d0f3df01a3233611a60ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/67/362867/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copy the deployment logs if present if [ -d $BASE/new/ironic-bm-logs/deploy_logs ]; then sudo cp -r $BASE/new/ironic-bm-logs/deploy_logs $BASE/logs/ironic-bm-logs fi

commit_message:
Revert "Convergence cancel update implementation"

This change has introduced a problem: the old traversal ID is lost as we update
the traversal ID in state_set. The solution is to do the traversal update out
of state set.

This reverts commit 084d0eb20f6636b63721eb3c5a9db08858d05ec5.
Closes-Bug: #1618155

Change-Id: Ifea1fbbbe8eab4ed687246d9d160488267bc3c8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/01/362301/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add Release chapter to Contributor Guide

Spec to add a new chapter to the Contributor Guide to cover
documentation release processes.

Change-Id: Ifda2deda3f2fa954c4bf994f5bc6a9b5fcc7d0e5
blueprint: release-chapter-contrib-guide
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/docs-specs refs/changes/01/365801/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================== Documentation Contributor Guide reorganization ============================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+spec/contributor-guide-reorg To facilitate more documentation contributions, we should keep the contributor guide as readable as possible. Problem description =================== The Documentation Contributor Guide contains various useful contents for the docs contributors. Since we have added content gradually, however, the guide has become scattered. Proposed change =============== 1. Sort current contents by task group. 2. Clarify the tasks to contribute docs. 3. Reorganize and add the contents by tasks. Alternatives ------------ Keep the current guide as is. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- * Olga Gusarenko * KATO Tomoyuki Work Items ---------- * Sort current contents by task group. * Clarify the tasks to contribute docs. * Reorganize and add the contents by tasks. * Refine the contents for first timers. * Refine the contents for docs readers, such as bug reporting. * Refine the contents to build docs. * Refine the contents to write docs. * Refine the contents to review docs. * Refine the contents to contribute API docs. * Refine the contents to contribute installation guides. * Refine the contents to contribute UI/UX docs. * Refine the contents about team. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= None. References ========== * http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/ * https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/austin-docs-contributorguide

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception is caught and rethrown,
it should call 'raise' without any arguments
because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where
the exception re-raised

Change-Id: I7e11d11ee07fcc6e149d1349e4aba9f86b890c49
Closes-Bug: #1616696

commit_message:
Config logABug feature for zaqar api-ref

Currently, zaqar api-ref is not configured with logABug feature.
When users click "Report bug" button, it leads to "openstack-manuals"
which is default.

Change-Id: I94c15bb27ca3f920ba4f1a9622222ca891e1e663
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/24/363424/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Config logABug feature giturl = u'http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/zaqar/tree/api-ref/source' # source tree # html_context allows us to pass arbitrary values into the html template html_context = {'bug_tag': 'api-ref', 'giturl': giturl, 'bug_project': 'zaqar'}

commit_message:
Trunk: remove database transactions from the plugin

The implementation makes use of trunk objects. A object takes care
of the database transactions. This does not need to wrap the trunk
updates, creation etc.

Due to the fact that the transaction is removed the following
callback notifications are deleted (they were not refenced in the
code base):
 - PRECOMMIT_CREATE
 - PRECOMMIT_UPDATE
 - PRECOMMIT_DELETE

Partially-implement: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: I902898706f73af6d9e63f3f551b81df87b6f98a9

commit_message:
Remove experimental bandit job from anchor

The pep8 environment of anchor runs bandit with every change, no need
for an extra experimental change anymore. Remove it.

Change-Id: I973c069618a540956a9d3d67f1684ff307a6ef22

commit_message:
Remove octavia bandit job

Octavia runs bandit now as part of pep8 since bandit passes tests.
Remove the extra jobs.

Note that the original change I490301c1ecc493e90a10b10dbac2de94dbe4f0f0
enabled this only on master, our xenial changes added the extra trusty
job. Therefore there's no need to backport the change or treat stable
branches special.

Change-Id: Ia634f4e577a0524ee6713702429db3e5d7528d78
Depends-On: Id65a50c35723b79e9b92952d138e60ee998c341c

commit_message:
Fix CapacityFilter to accept None volume type

Change I8b43624b934fadf1036fafa1f5e2b94b5317f81c introduced reading
volume_type['extra specs'] from filter_properties in CapacityFilter
without taking into account that volume_type can be None (when
default_volume_type is not set in cinder.conf). This commit fixes that.

Closes-Bug: 1619246
Change-Id: Icfc6ba5f47c3a61b49cbec5110ef7df05eb47195
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/45/364245/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove some unused jobs from JJB

Remove a handfull of jobs that are not used in zuul from JJB setup.

Note that defcore has no stable branches, thus we can remove the trusty
docs job from zuul/layout.

Change-Id: I2f607e63c9a3470fe5543f3857980b2e465fcc45

subject: compute: don't use 'host-model' CPU mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-30 18:53:35.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/roles/compute.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/11e7a886d50b8c151cc31c1fcca530f4c18e3259', 'message': "compute: don't use 'host-model' CPU mode

The `host-model' CPU mode is known to result in non-working combinations
of CPU features and other parameters (such as CPUID level) which confuse
the guest OS. In particular on Core i7 hosts the avx2 instructions are
advertised to the guest kernel. However depending on the hardware, host
kernel version, *and* qemu these instructions might be unavailable in
the guest mode. Thus a guest kernel gets an invalid opcode exception
(and paincs) when trying to execute an avx2 instruction.

To avoid the problem never enable the `host-model' cpu_mode in nova.conf,
use the libvirt default instead.

As a side effect this patch should make it possible to use the (nested)
hardware assisted virtualization on virtual compute nodes (which might
make MOS/Fuel CI quite a bit faster).

Closes-Bug: #1618473
Change-Id: Id4d36d88ff452b91c2990af5de36b628a13d04ca
"}]
commit_message:
compute: don't use 'host-model' CPU mode

The `host-model' CPU mode is known to result in non-working combinations
of CPU features and other parameters (such as CPUID level) which confuse
the guest OS. In particular on Core i7 hosts the avx2 instructions are
advertised to the guest kernel. However depending on the hardware, host
kernel version, *and* qemu these instructions might be unavailable in
the guest mode. Thus a guest kernel gets an invalid opcode exception
(and paincs) when trying to execute an avx2 instruction.

To avoid the problem never enable the `host-model' cpu_mode in nova.conf,
use the libvirt default instead.

As a side effect this patch should make it possible to use the (nested)
hardware assisted virtualization on virtual compute nodes (which might
make MOS/Fuel CI quite a bit faster).

Closes-Bug: #1618473
Change-Id: Id4d36d88ff452b91c2990af5de36b628a13d04ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/24/363124/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # CPU configuration created using host-model may not work as expected. # The guest CPU may differ from the configuration and it may also confuse # guest OS by using a combination of CPU features and other parameters (such # as CPUID level) that don't work. Until these issues are fixed, it's a good # idea to avoid using host-model # http://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsCPU # https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1618473 $libvirt_cpu_mode = 'none'

commit_message:
Fix HNAS stats reporting

HNAS driver pools are not reporting thin_provisioning to scheduler,
so when creating a volume, is not possible to limit the usage of
the backend space.

Change-Id: I16c3b4025b841a122d76ae4b7a44667c999236e2
Partial-bug: #1600295
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/77/344477/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: max_osr = self.max_over_subscription_ratio for pool in self.pools: capacity, free, provisioned = self._get_capacity_info(pool['fs']) pool['provisioned_capacity_gb'] = provisioned / float(units.Gi) pool['reserved_percentage'] = self.reserved_percentage pool['max_over_subscription_ratio'] = max_osr pool['thin_provisioning_support'] = True pool['thick_provisioning_support'] = False pool['reserved_percentage'] = self.reserved_percentage
deleted_lines: for pool in self.pools: capacity, free, used = self._get_capacity_info(pool['fs']) pool['allocated_capacity_gb'] = used / float(units.Gi) pool['reserved_percentage'] = 0

commit_message:
Deprecate swift-temp-url

python-swiftclient includes an improved and tested method to generate
tempurls. The command syntax is essentially the same, therefore we can
deprecate this one by importing that method.

python-swiftclient is not added as a requirement; if the import fails
due to a missing swiftclient module it will just raise a deprecation
warning.

Closes-Bug: #1607523
Closes-Bug: #1607519

Change-Id: Ifa8bf636f20f82db4845b02d1b58699edaa39356

commit_message:
Remove --lb-method from lbaas v2 pool and add lb_algorithm

LBaaS v2 pool does not support --lb-method.
This patch removes it from the test cases.
It also adds the lb_algorithm in List Pool,
as it was earlier being displayed as lb_method.

Change-Id: I17a5426e80235c85fe35070f223a611a4dfce7ef

deleted_lines: lb_method = 'ROUND_ROBIN' args = ['--lb-method', lb_method, '--name', name, position_names = ['admin_state_up', 'lb_method', 'name', position_values = [True, lb_method, name, lb_method = 'ROUND_ROBIN' '--lb-method', lb_method, position_names = ['admin_state_up', 'description', 'lb_method', 'name', position_values = [False, description, lb_method, name,

subject: Raise error for duplicate parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-02 08:49:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/85deb3385c9d90a3db804f08b4294e8f538dd564', 'message': "Raise exc for dup param[DONT REVIEW][TC MISSING]

Currently, if duplicate parameters are provided in a neutron CLI,
then the last parameter and its value is accepted.
However, this behavior is not correct. In order to follow the principle
'explicit is better than implicit', this patch is designed to generate
a message if duplicate parameters are infact passed into the CLI.

Change-Id: I869b31aa4e06e323d35ac6124f345c63fcd4015d
Closes-Bug:#1327071
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-26 05:13:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/4e5a3fb8e2ffc2e85948d6aa1e2e2af2ac5b5d97', 'message': "Raise error for duplicate parameters

Currently, if duplicate parameters are passed to a neutron CLI
and they cannot be appended(decided by argument parser), then
the last occurrance of the duplicate parameter and its value is
accepted. However, this behavior is not correct. In order to follow the principle
'explicit is better than implicit', this patch is designed to raise
an error message if such duplicate parameters are passed into the CLI.

Change-Id: I869b31aa4e06e323d35ac6124f345c63fcd4015d
Closes-Bug: #1327071

commit_message:
Raise error for duplicate parameters

Currently, if duplicate parameters are passed to a neutron CLI
and they cannot be appended(decided by argument parser), then
the last occurrence of the duplicate parameter and its value is
accepted. However, this behavior is not correct. In order to follow
the principle 'explicit is better than implicit', this patch is
designed to raise an error message if such duplicate parameters
are passed into the CLI.

Change-Id: I869b31aa4e06e323d35ac6124f345c63fcd4015d
Closes-Bug:#1327071
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/21/230321/36 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.check_for_duplicate_parameters(sub_argv) def check_for_duplicate_parameters(self,sub_argv): sub_argv = list(sub_argv) param_list = [] try: for param in sub_argv: if '--' in param: if param in param_list: raise Exception else: param_list.append(param) except Exception: self.log.error("%s","Duplicate parameters found") raise

commit_message:
Use oslo.i18n to translate messages in kolla project

1.Add oslo.i18n module.
2.Help messages and output info should support oslo.i18n.
So we should use oslo.i18n in LOG.warning()/LOG.error()/
LOG.info()/LOG.critical()/LOG.debug()/LOG.exception().

The more information as follow:
 [1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html
 [2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/usage.html

Change-Id: I9339b4521fcbba02c798e3a225ce0d7727785c87
Implements: blueprint kolla-stadium-i18n

commit_message:
Move wait_for_qos_operations into base volume test

wait_for_qos_operations() is just a wrapper method, and a service
client module is not a good place to keep the method as a stable
interface.
This patch moves wait_for_qos_operations into base volume test
module.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Icb049981630142b68a7473c2e04979a6ae3942a0

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style
guidelines they recommend to import only modules.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: Ife352b2b5078d18ea080aef03871f61f34e105b7

commit_message:
Use 'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host' directly

On the history, Tempest needed to support Nova v2 and v3 APIs which
are different request/response parameters. And Tempest switched the
parameter names by using class values. However, Nova team has dropped
Nova v3 API and the corresponding tests also have been removed from
Tempest. Now the class values are unuseful and less readability.

This patch makes Tempest use 'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host' directly.

Change-Id: Ia5d8d45578854279c914613d1dd5590e3cc0c60b

commit_message:
Add "volume service set" command

Add "volume service set" command in volume v1 and v2
(v1 is the same as v2) to disable or enable volume service.

Change-Id: Ibb2db7e93b24cb2e0d2a7c28b6fd8bcc851b8d2f
Closes-Bug: #1613597

commit_message:
Documentation on pod and pod binding

1. What is the problem
Pod and pod binding functions have been implemented, but the documentation
is not there.

2. What is the solution for the problem
Pod and pod binding have four main public functions respectively. For pod,
there are four public functions: 1) get pod list. 2) show a single pod in
detail. 3) create a pod. 4) delete a pod. Likewise, pod binding has four
similar public functions to pod. The file /tricircle/doc/source/api_v1.rst
includes the request and response explanation about each function.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
None.

Change-Id: Ic530326bb00556b5b9e8d4e4699eaa35ebf01e61
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/91/356291/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =============================================================================================== A pod represents a region in Keystone. When operating a pod, Tricircle decides the correct endpoints to send request based on the region of the pod.**pod_name** is specified by user but **MUST** match the region name registered in Keystone. When creating a bottom pod, Tricircle automatically creates a host aggregate and assigns the new availability zone id to it. **az_name**. When **az_name** is empty, that means this pod is top region, no host aggregate will be generated. If **az_name** is not empty, that means this pod will belong to this availability zone. Multiple pods with same **az_name** means that these pods are under same availability zone. Delete a Pod [DELETE] ---------------------- - URL: /pods/pod_id - Status: 202 - Returns: None Response Delete a pod from availability-zone. Pod Binding [/podbindings/{podbinding_id}] ========================================== A pod binding represents a mapping relationship between a tenant and pods. Pods are classified into different categories. A tenant will be bound to different pod groups for different purposes. When a pod binding happens, there are three main attributes: - tenant_id - pod_id - podbinding_id **tenant_id** is automatically generated when adding a new cloud service user. "Tenant" is the old term for a project in Keystone. Starting in API version 3, "project" is the preferred term. Accordingly, **project_id** is used instead of **tenant_id**. **pod_id** is automatically generated when creating a site. **podbinding_id** is automatically generated when new binding relation happens between tenant and pod. Retrieve Pod Binding List [GET] -------------------------------- - URL: /podbindings - Status: 200 - Returns: List of Pods Response The value returned is a json format nodes list, including all the mapping relationships between tenants and pods. Retrieve a Single Pod Binding [GET] ------------------------------------ - URL: /podbindings/podbinding_id - Status: 200 - Returns: pod_binding Response The value returned includes a single json format node containing a mapping relationship between a tenant and a pod. Node content consists of three main elements: tenant_id, pod_id, podbinding_id. The value of podbinding_id is the same as the request parameter podbinding_id. Create a Pod Binding [POST] ---------------------------- - URL: /podbindings - Status: 201 - Returns: Created Pod Binding Request (application/json) The request value is a single json format node containing a mapping relationship between tenant and pod. Response Insert a new record in pod binding table. For each record a new item named podbinding_id will be generated. Delete a Pod Binding [DELETE] ------------------------------ - URL: /podbindings/podbinding_id - Status: 202 - Returns: None Response Delete a pod binding record from the pod binding table.
deleted_lines: ============================================================================================= A pod represents a region in Keystone. When operating a pod, Tricircle decides the correct endpoints to send request based on the region of the pod.**pod_name** is specified by user but **MUST** match the region name registered in Keystone. When creating a bottom pod, Tricircle automatically creates a host aggregate and assigns the new availability zone id to **az_name**. When **az_name** is empty, that means this pod is top region, no host aggregate will be generated. If **az_name** is not empty, that means this pod will belong to this availability zone. Multiple pods with same **az_name** means that these pods are under same availability zone.URL Parameters -------------- - pod_id: Pod id Models ------ :: { "pod_id": "302e02a6-523c-4a92-a8d1-4939b31a788c", "pod_name": "pod1", "pod_az_name": "az1", "dc_name": "data center 1", "az_name": "az1" }

commit_message:
test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if
we use method CONF.set_override without parameter
enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True

Change-Id: I2ec6f354e43ccbe5e9f0e3907d558673ac88c860
Closes-Bug: #1517839

commit_message:
cluster-check results the status error

After cluster-check, the status of the cluster is changed from ACTIVE to WARNING.

The node status is changed from "ACTIVE" to "CHECK: Node is ACTIVE."

In eval_status funcion, the cluster status is evaluated as "WARNING"
because of the error node status.

Change-Id: I707ee7956cb94032dee508a5a61aeccf2d9fa84e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/99/365199/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.set_status(self.ACTIVE, _("ACTIVE")) else: self.set_status(self.ERROR, _("ERROR"))
deleted_lines: self.set_status(self.ACTIVE, _("Check: Node is ACTIVE.")) else: self.set_status(self.ERROR, _("Check: Node is not ACTIVE."))

commit_message:
Add group snapshots - APIs

This is the fifth patch that implements the generic-volume-group
bluerpint. It adds APIs for group snapshots and create group
from source.

This patch depends on the fourth patch which implements group
snapshots support in the volume manager:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/361376/

Client side patch is here:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329770/

Current microversion is 3.14. The following CLI's are supported:
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.14 group-create-from-src
    --name my_group --group-snapshot <group snapshot uuid>
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.14 group-create-from-src
    --name my_group --source-group <source group uuid>
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.14 group-snapshot-create
    --name <name> <group uuid>
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.14 group-snapshot-list
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.14 group-snapshot-show
    <group snapshot uuid>
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.14 group-snapshot-delete
    <group snapshot uuid>

APIImpact
DocImpact
Partial-Implements: blueprint generic-volume-group

Change-Id: I2e628968afcf058113e1f1aeb851570c7f0f3a08

subject: Fix api reference of object GET request with Range parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 07:10:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/ca78bae8b7e644a3bf50514d2e5ff06b408df36b', 'message': "Fix api referece of object GET request with Range pameter

In RFC 7233, response body size of range requests with parameter 'bytes=N-M'
is (M - N + 1). And Respose of object GET request with Range parameter in
current Swift implementation in according to the RFC.  However, in current
api referece explains that responce body size of object GET request with
'Range: bytes=10-15' is five( != 15 - 10 + 1).
This patch fixes the api reference explanation.

Change-Id: I8371864f8e5adb42c1e56b7ea26c556ea1252728
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-02 01:55:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/c2fd5c63a0d3b67a6cb67e13536b93cd3dacfaaa', 'message': "Fix api reference of object GET request with Range parameter

In RFC 7233, response body size of range requests with parameter
'bytes=N-M' is (M - N + 1). And response of object GET request with
range parameter in current Swift implementation is according to the
RFC.  However, in current api reference explains that responce body
size of object GET request with 'Range: bytes=10-15' is five

commit_message:
Fix api reference of object GET request with Range parameter

In RFC 7233, response body size of range requests with parameter
'bytes=N-M' is (M - N + 1). And response of object GET request with
range parameter in current Swift implementation is according to the
RFC.  However, in current api reference explains that response body
size of object GET request with 'Range: bytes=10-15' is five
( != 15 - 10 + 1).
This patch fixes the api reference explanation.

Change-Id: I8371864f8e5adb42c1e56b7ea26c556ea1252728

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Closes-Bug: #1620161

commit_message:
Improve Swift Usage command examples

Few Swift commands in the doc/cli-reference missed to present the
required arguments in the Usage; which could be misleading to the user

e.g.   Was-> Usage: swift download
Changed to-> Usage: swift download <container> <object>

Change-Id: Ida8b754de6e63d080e7b1124df93d4a35dac7603
Closes-Bug: #1618997
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/49/363949/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Usage: swift delete [<container>] [<object>] Usage: swift download [<container>] [<object>] Usage: swift post [<container>] [<object>] Usage: swift tempurl [<method>] [<seconds>] [<path>] [<key>] Usage: swift upload [<container>] [<file_or_directory>]
deleted_lines: Usage: swift delete Usage: swift download Usage: swift post Usage: swift tempurl Usage: swift upload

commit_message:
Get rid of Template.validate_condition_definitions()

Following on from the deprecation of validate_resource_definitions() from
the Template interface, also remove validate_condition_definitions(). The
definitions will be validated when calling Template.conditions(), which
now occurs when loading the resource definitions, so it will still happen
during Stack.validate().

Since this interface is new and has never appeared in a release, we have no
need to go through a deprecation process.

Change-Id: I4dc36433c1aca776c2151205ed26a0f5241a750a

commit_message:
Evaluate resource conditions in-place

This allows us to parse the conditions only once instead of reparsing them
all every time we encountered a resource with a condition. It also allows
us to get rid of some of the API surface area and reduces our reliance on
some of the rest.

Partial-Bug: #1618713

Change-Id: I3c2273722171b9c4cb13ef6588f7b522b6689b1c

commit_message:
Add documentation for EMC Unity Driver for Manila

Enhance the development document for EMC Unity Driver for Manila.
Details including:

* Add configuration description section to list all configuration
  options.
* Add restrictions for NFS and CIFS access control.
* Add Unity pre-configurations section.
* Add module section.

Change-Id: Ib617dfd07b8d98269677e3dca907162187cdf15d
Closes-Bug: #1608002
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/76/358576/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: On Unity System ``````````````` 1. Configure System level NTP Server Configure the NTP server for your Unity at: Unisphere -> Settings -> Management -> System Time and NTP Select "Enable NTP synchronization" and add your NTP server(s). 2. Configure System level DNS Server Configure the DNS server for your Unity at: Unisphere -> Settings -> Management -> DNS Server Select "Configure DNS server address manually" and add your DNS server(s). Following configurations need to be configured in `/etc/manila/manila.conf` for the Unity driver. share_driver = manila.share.drivers.emc.driver.EMCShareDriver emc_share_backend = unity emc_nas_server = <management IP address of the Unity system> emc_nas_login = <user with administrator privilege> emc_nas_password = <password> emc_nas_server_container = [SPA|SPB] emc_nas_pool_names = <Comma separated pool names> emc_interface_ports = <Comma separated ports list> - `emc_share_backend` is the plugin name. Set it to `unity` for the Unity driver. - `emc_nas_server` is the management IP for Unity. - `emc_nas_server_container` specifies the SP that will be used as share server. - `emc_nas_pool_names` is the name of the pools to be used by this backend. If no name is specified, all storage pool on the system will be managed.- `emc_interface_ports` is the white list of the ports to be used for connection. Wild card character is supported. Examples: spa_eth1, spa_*, * Restart of :term:`manila-share` service is needed for the configuration changes to take effect. Restrictions ------------ The Unity drive has following restrictions. - EMC Unity does not support the same IP in different VLANs. - Only IP access type is supported for NFS. - Only user access type is supported for CIFS The :mod:`manila.share.drivers.emc.driver` Module ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. automodule:: manila.share.drivers.emc.driver :noindex: :members: :undoc-members: :show-inheritance: The :mod:`manila.share.drivers.emc.plugins.unity.connection` Module ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. automodule:: manila.share.drivers.emc.plugins.unity.connection :noindex: :members: :undoc-members: :show-inheritance:
deleted_lines: Following configurations are introduced for the Unity plugin. * emc_interface_ports: White list of the ports to be used for connection. Examples: spa_eth1, spa_*, * * emc_nas_server_pool: The pool used to persist the meta-data of created NAS servers. Wild card character is supported.Restrictions ------------ * EMC Unity does not support the same IP in different VLANs.

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv for tricircle

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim support for
Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch also adds the
convenience py35 venv.

Change-Id: I3a33c3de0a79f6f80853a3a63795fb80803b1d84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/91/365391/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py35,py34,py27,pypy,pep8

1. What is the problem
The current Nova_APIGW does not support microversion function, the service
controller uses a fixed API version number to initialize novaclient

2. What is the solution to the problem
When the service controller receives an API request, it will get the
microversion number from request headers , and use this to initialize
novaclient.

   to realize the solution

commit_message:
Nova_APIGW REST API Microversion Support

1. What is the problem
The current Nova_APIGW does not support microversion function, the service
controller uses a fixed API version number to initialize novaclient

2. What is the solution to the problem
When the service controller receives an API request, it will get the
microversion number from request headers , and use this to initialize
novaclient.

For how to get the microversion number, please refer to:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo/implemented/api-microversions.html

The microversion supported range is 2.1 to latest version

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
   Nova_APIGW microversion support added

Change-Id: Idf44c91100e5cb8ad0355164c9be991aa54a652b

commit_message:
Solve problem when installing ovs

Add --force-yes to apt-get command line. When installing ovs
dependencies, apt-get install -y is used to confirm automatically.
If the package signature owner's public-key is not in the keyring,
the installation still stops.

Change-Id: Id84c97786394cb1d241aa1dec4926eafa62c79cb

Use timeutils for utcnow()

This change makes some lines to use timeutils.utcnow()
and remove trove.common.utils.utcnow()

TrivialFix

commit_message:
WIP conf opt: added check for help msg line lenght

Note: this requires all config options to be compatible with change, thus
it cannot be merged before this requirement is met.

Because of how doc generation works, the real line length limit for help
messages in config options is not 79 but 77 - doc prepends every line with
'# ' which results in line being 81 characters. In this case, line break is
inserted and new line with single word is created.

This work is based on code by markus_z.

Co-Authored-By: Markus Zoeller <mzoeller@de.ibm.com>
Implements blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I4e169aca4a8da67484836bd8ffc0cf439b352471
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/54/362454/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - [N353] Limit line length in configuration options files to 77 characters

commit_message:
Dell SC: Add dell_server_os configuration option

Added dell_server_os option. If a server is created on the Dell
DSM via the Dell SC Cinder driver it is created using this as
the Server OS type.

The default is still Red Hat Linux 6.x.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I681c40beef56fb29b72cb673edc8eb43cfb553e4

commit_message:

commit_message:
Fix incorrectly implemented footer blocks

It appears that there has been a varied implementation of the
{{ include_footer }} and {{ block footer }} for base images.

As it turns out, the base Dockerfiles should not include
the generic footers as this will cause the images that inherit
the base images to have the footer code to be repeated.

This aims to fix all base images to remove the generic footer
while ensuring that the image specific footer remains.

Change-Id: I6621b328571466ba9e9333e35c2912f865e63fd1
Partially-implements: blueprint third-party-plugin-support

commit_message:
Ignore lvm descriptor leak warning on vgs calls

There's been a bug reported against LVM that's been outstanding
for a couple of years regarding an "leaded descriptor" error
message coming back from vgs calls.

Something unique about Kolla/Kubernetes seems to hit this fairly
regularly and the default process.execute see the error message and
code and raises, causing the vgs to fail every time.

This patch catches the exception and checks to see if it's this
special case and if we can ignore it.

Change-Id: Ia13b3b8159ecb730daf2dd1c55ec0a880aa22f0c
Closes-Bug: #1619701
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/80/365080/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Parent PID 28: " "Volume group cinder-volumes not found ", cmd=cmd) with mock.patch.object(self.vg, '_execute', _fake_execute): self.assertFalse(self.vg._vg_exists()) def test_vgs_ignores_leak_warning(self): def _fake_execute(obj, *cmd, **kwargs): # noqa raise processutils.ProcessExecutionError( exit_code=5, stdout=self.vg.vg_name, stderr="File descriptor 19 (/dev/urandom) leaked on vgs " "invocation. Parent PID 28: " "Volume group cinder-volumes not found ", cmd=cmd) with mock.patch.object(self.vg, '_execute', _fake_execute): self.assertTrue(self.vg._vg_exists())

subject: Make hooks dir discovery more flexible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-22 01:21:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat-templates/commit/1ba9e4de5dbee5e1738715068128756c0a0ac76a', 'message': 'Make hooks dir discovery more flexible

Currently the hooks dir is statically set to $HEAT_CONFIG_HOOKS or
/var/lib/heat-config/hooks.

This commit changes the approach to finding the hook to execute, it
now looks for the requested hook from a list of directories. The new
directory /usr/libexec/heat-config/hooks has precedence over the old
/var/lib/heat-config/hooks.

The reason for this is that /usr/libexec is a more appropriate
location for downstream packaging to install hook scripts (RDO, debian
etc).

This approach will gracefully handle upgrading an image built with
hooks in /var/lib/heat-config/hooks followed by a package based
upgrade which switches some or all of the hooks to
/usr/libexec/heat-config/hooks.

commit_message:
Make hooks dir discovery more flexible

Currently the hooks dir is statically set to $HEAT_CONFIG_HOOKS or
/var/lib/heat-config/hooks.

This commit changes the approach to finding the hook to execute, it
now looks for the requested hook from a list of directories. The new
directory /usr/libexec/heat-config/hooks has precedence over the old
/var/lib/heat-config/hooks.

The reason for this is that /usr/libexec is a more appropriate
location for downstream packaging to install hook scripts (RDO, debian
etc).

This approach will gracefully handle upgrading an image built with
hooks in /var/lib/heat-config/hooks followed by a package based
upgrade which switches some or all of the hooks to
/usr/libexec/heat-config/hooks.

Change-Id: Id0262e8ab1f96fa556e2ffbdf8b1b25be14ea97b

commit_message:
Break out inlined boot config files

These are better on their own for maintainability.

Tested locally by successfully launching stack
example-config-pristine-image.yaml with CentOS 7 and the previous
change in this series.

Change-Id: I44650f6b40c8b7a8060f8b7408b2f3d8695aaf36

commit_message:
Make versioned_writes docstring more precise

Add a note to the docstring that it is required to add a config section
to the proxy-server.conf and an entry to the pipeline to support history
mode.

Closes-Bug: 1619261
Change-Id: I888485ab4ece6f47db081a4d58c1aab24ce72a8a

commit_message:
Improve Active Directory installation

Improvements:
    - added HeatSignal to report the status of the stack
    - mapped the default admin to work on localized versions of windows
    - added more reliability by retrying the steps that can encounter
      transient errors

Change-Id: Iae9f6fe0ccb9fbf4a6091cd8486d9271570e6777

commit_message:
Remove meaningless lines in reconciler unit test

There are two lines in which lists are sorted in test_reconciler.py
However, the values in the lists will be same, then the two lines are
meaningless.
This patch removes the two lines from test_reconciler.py

Change-Id: I7d72a7a4e9a27d87cd78c96f79d1b340b2ad23de

commit_message:
Add supported driver checks to Zone Manager

This patch adds the supported driver checks to the
Fibre Channel Zone Manager.  This is the same mechanism
that is in Cinder volume drivers.

When a zone manager driver is marked as unsupported, the zone manager
won't allow it to work unless the enable_unsupported_driver=True is
added to the fc-zone-manager section in cinder.conf

Change-Id: If707b9005f60dc28eb99f46929fb700a2de0f755
Implements: blueprint zonemanager-supported-driver

added_lines: # If a driver hasn't maintained their CI system, this will get set # to False, which prevents the driver from starting. # Add enable_unsupported_driver = True in cinder.conf to get the # unsupported driver started. self._supported = True @property def supported(self): return self._supported
