subject: Use repo_name as literal in bug_project
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-31 13:00:49.000000000', 'files': ['{{cookiecutter.repo_name}}/install-guide/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/installguide-cookiecutter/commit/f6408cb0761f555864f2885a9c0da77d0f6666f8', 'message': 'Use repo_name as literal in bug_project

Additionally, fix E501 line too long violations in configuration file.
This should help smoothen inclusion in projects where such checks are
applied.

Note that the giturl line uses the noqa tag instead of the multi-line
approach. I find that it reads better that way.

Change-Id: I0d06f2bf85ce6b28d7bef04ad20fe64f575cc0f6
'}]
commit_message:
Use repo_name as literal in bug_project

Additionally, fix E501 line too long violations in configuration file.
This should help smoothen inclusion in projects where such checks are
applied.

Note that the giturl line uses the noqa tag instead of the multi-line
approach. I find that it reads better that way.

Change-Id: I0d06f2bf85ce6b28d7bef04ad20fe64f575cc0f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/installguide-cookiecutter refs/changes/33/363633/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # gitsha: The SHA checksum of the bug description. Automatically extracted # from git log.giturl = u'http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/{{cookiecutter.codename}}/tree/install-guide/source' # noqa "bug_project": "{{cookiecutter.codename}}"}
deleted_lines: # gitsha: The SHA checksum of the bug description. Automatically extracted from git log.giturl = u'http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/{{cookiecutter.codename}}/tree/install-guide/source' "bug_project": {{cookiecutter.codename}}}

commit_message:
Identify config block as ini config

Currently, the configuration block provided as an example uses a "none"
type. This makes doc8 return D000 codes for 'D000 Cannot analyze code.
No Pygments lexer found for "none".'

Change-Id: Icb96cc24c07aaac962ddf03bbbbb2821b1e90892

commit_message:
Update stable constraints url

This goes through all projects listed in requirements projects.txt and
updates their tox.ini updating the URL for upper-constraints.txt
with the appropriate branch.

This will be useful for catching accidental omissions and updating a
large number of projects after a requirements release.

Change-Id: I67a4c6803a78dee6ae78df78d437ca4c7c8003e2

commit_message:
Optimize number of keystone workers

We need to limit maximum number of keystone workers, because on
high-end servers keystone may spawn too many workers which may
decrease performance.

Change-Id: I1cb17fe34ae0bea6403805f0a9997ff73670ed8c
Closes-bug: #1487486

commit_message:
Fix unit tests for 6.1

- Update unit tests script to add functionality
- Fix Gemfile for l23network module
- Add modules with broken unit tests to the list of excludes

Related-bug: #1455847
Change-Id: I5c2dfb1cd180304ad8b120517f8e820172ba0142
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/86/219186/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: usage="$(basename "$0") [-h] [-m MODULE] [-a] -- runs unit tests for puppet modules, by default runs tests only for changed modules. where: -h show this help text -a|--all run unit tests for all modules -m|--module MODULE run unit tests for specified module " while [[ $# > 0 ]] ; do key="$1" case $key in -a|--all) ALL='1' ;; -m|--modules) MODULES="$MODULES $2" shift # past argument ;; -h|--help) echo "$usage" >&2 exit 0 ;; *) # unknown option ;; esac shift # past argument or value done if [ "$ALL" == '1' ] ; then modules=`ls -d $WORKSPACE/deployment/puppet/*` elif ! [ -z "$MODULES" ] ; then modules=$MODULES else git diff --name-only HEAD~ &>/dev/null || exit 1 modules=$(git diff --name-only HEAD~ | grep -o 'deployment/puppet/[^/]*/' | sort -u) fi echo "Checking modules: $modules"
deleted_lines: modules=$(git diff --name-only HEAD~ | grep -o 'deployment/puppet/[^/]*/' | sort -u) git diff --name-only HEAD~ &>/dev/null || exit 1

to grab logs using devstack-gate script.

commit_message:
NPM DSVM jobs are now voting.

Our gate tests now run correctly, even though they're currently
failing. This patch enables voting on them. Yay voting!

Change-Id: I4920841b53aa93db3f4b508d45361bac059b63a9

commit_message:
Update python-cinderclient to 1.9.0

- Replace python-keystoneclient with keystoneauth1 for Requires
  and BuildRequires
- Add oslo.utils as BuildRequires

Change-Id: Ibe11b05254d72853fe3d32835bfc733660ab5456

commit_message:
Switch windmill centos-7 roles voting

Our non-voting jobs have been stable for a while. Lets promote them to
voting.

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix kuryr-libnetwork fullstack job and rally job

kuryr has been splited into kuryr and kuryr-libnetwork.
Update kuryr to kuryr-libnetwork in kuryr-libnetwork
fullstack and rally job.

Partially Implements blueprint code-refactoring

Change-Id: I258cd3ead52ee45035dc5c9ae26be3dc01ef4206

commit_message:
Enable python35-jobs for scciclient

This patch makes python35-jobs voting effective by replacing
python35-jobs-nv to python35-jobs, and refactored existing jobs.

Change-Id: Ic4d5378fac5458a90aaaafb42b040d3405a96686

commit_message:
[qcow2][kubernetes] Switch to MCP image for kubernetes build

  Switch to private docker container from MCP team for binaries
  https://mcp-ci.ng.mirantis.net/artifactory as source.

Change-Id: I043d247a68479821950dc71822f2f68192d9822f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-apps refs/changes/74/365474/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #install-packages curl wget linux-libc-dev git gcc libc6-dev bridge-utils haproxy ntp ntpdate docker.io systemctl start docker.serviceMCP_REGISTRY_URI="mcp-ci.ng.mirantis.net:5002" MCP_IMAGE_NAME="hyperkube-amd64" MCP_IMAGE_TAG="v1.4.0-alpha.2-1582-ge32e1b_51"# Install latest kubernetes and calico from MCP image. MCP registry should be available docker pull ${MCP_REGISTRY_URI}/${MCP_IMAGE_NAME}:${MCP_IMAGE_TAG} CONTAINER_ID=`docker ps --no-trunc -q` docker cp ${CONTAINER_ID}:/hyperkube ${SVC_ROOT} docker cp ${CONTAINER_ID}:/make-ca-cert.sh / docker cp ${CONTAINER_ID}:/setup-files.sh / docker cp ${CONTAINER_ID}:/etc/kubernetes ${SVC_ROOT} CERTS=`./setup-files.sh 127.0.0.1` docker rmi -f ${MCP_REGISTRY_URI}/${MCP_IMAGE_NAME}:${MCP_IMAGE_TAG} rm /make-ca-cert.sh /setup-files.sh docker cp ${CONTAINER_ID}:/opt/cni ${SVC_ROOT} # Install calico #TBD
deleted_lines: install-packages curl wget linux-libc-dev git gcc libc6-dev bridge-utils haproxy ntp ntpdateKUBE_LATEST_VERSION="v1.3.0"KUBE_LATEST_URL="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/releases/download/${KUBE_LATEST_VERSION}/kubernetes.tar.gz"# Install latest kubernetes wget -O ${SVC_ROOT}/kubernetes-latest.tar.gz $KUBE_LATEST_URL tar xzvf ${SVC_ROOT}/kubernetes-latest.tar.gz rm -f ${SVC_ROOT}/kubernetes-latest.tar.gz tar xzvf ${SVC_ROOT}/kubernetes/server/kubernetes-server-linux-amd64.tar.gz mv ${SVC_ROOT}/kubernetes ${SVC_ROOT}/kubernetes-latest cp ${SVC_ROOT}/kubernetes-latest/server/bin/* ${SVC_ROOT}/
